result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert T. Tuck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing [Modifiers: Penalty - Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Robert T. Tuck in court with attorney William M Ginsberg.  Christine M Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Complaint filed in 11 CM 536, waives reading,, 11 CM 536, Atty Ginsberg requesting an oral motion to withdraw plea to Ct. 1, Court grants motion to withdraw, Court amends plea to Ct. 3,  Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 3 in 11 CM 536, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation, 2 years, $343.00 costs and $200.00 DNA Surcharge, AODA and comply, absolute sobriety, 14 CF 35, Amended Information filed, waives reading, Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, 2 years probation, concurrent, Ct. 1, $243.00 costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, AODA and comply, absolute sobriety, 10 days jail w/Huber concurrent, Ct. 2, $243.00 costs and $200.00 DNA Surcharge, AODA and comply, absolute sobriety, 10 days jail w/Huber concurrent to Ct. 1, Jail start date 8/4/14 at 7:00 P.M., Defendant to report to probation and parole by Noon tomorrow, 6/20/14, 4 days sentence credit on 14 CF 35
plea and sentence on June 19 at 2:45 p.m.
